reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Contribute towards achieving the targets of National Strategic Plan aligned with End TB Strategy for reducing the burden of TB and MDR-TB in Pakistan.

description.narrative: Pakistan - Tuberculosis - National TB Control Programme Pakistan - NTP. This program has the following goals: Contribute to achieving the goal of the national strategy to control TB in Pakistan which is to reduce by 50% the prevalence of TB by 2025 in comparison to 2011. Contribute towards decreasing the prevalence, by at least 5% per year from 2018 onwards, the prevalence of MDR-TB among TB patients who have never received any TB treament. The objectives of this program are: To increase TB case notification (all forms) from 70% of estimated incident cases in 2014-15 to 85% of estimated incident cases by 2020 while maintaining treatment success rate at 91%. To enhance MDR-TB enrollment from 18% of estimated cases in 2014-15 to 33% of estimated by 2020. To increase the number of TB patients who are screened for HIV infection from 3% in 2014-15 to 10% by 2020

title.narrative: PAK-T-NTP Program Agreement 4
PAK-T-NTP Program Agreement
PAK-T-NTP Grant Performance Report
PAK-T-NTP Grant Performance Report
PAK-T-NTP Implementation Letter 1
PAK-T-NTP Implementation Letter 2
Coverage / Output indicator for PAK-T-NTP
TCP Other- 3: Proportion of bacteriologically positive TB cases among new and relapse pulmonary TB cases.
Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
Proportion of facility reports received over the reports expected during the reporting period
Number of notified TB cases (all forms) contributed by non-national TB program providers – private/non-governmental facilities
Percentage of bacteriologically confirmed TB cases successfully treated (cured plus completed treatment) among the bacteriologically confirmed TB cases registered during a specified period
Percentage of health facilities with tracer medicines for the three diseases available on the day of the visit or day of reporting

Percentage of laboratories showing adequate performance in external quality assurance for smear microscopy among the total number of laboratories that undertake smear microscopy during the reporting period
Percentage of health facilities providing diagnostic services with tracer items available on the day of the visit or day of reporting
Percentage of TB patients who had an HIV test result recorded in the TB register
Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment
Number of notified cases of bacteriologically confirmed TB, new and relapses
TCP Other-1: Proportion of bacteriologically confirmed of pulmonary TB (new and relapse cases)
Percentage of new and relapse TB patients tested using WHO recommended rapid tests at the time of diagnosis
Percentage of reporting units reporting no stock-outs of anti-TB drugs on the last day of the quarter
M&E-2b Timeliness of facility reporting: Percentage of submitted facility quarterly reports (for the reporting period) that are received on time per the national guidelines
Timeliness of facility reporting: Percentage of submitted facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are received on time per the national guidelines
MDR/TB- other 1: Percentage of TB patients with DST result for at least Rifampicin among the total number of notified (new and retreatment) cases in the same year
Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified
Number of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases
Percentage of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment

Treatment success rate- all forms: Percentage of TB cases, all forms, bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, successfully treated (cured plus treatment completed) among all TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period, new and relapse cases
Percentage of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB started on treatment for MDR-TB who were lost to follow up during the first six months of treatment
Number of notified TB cases (all forms) contributed by non-national TB program providers – public sector
Percentage of DST laboratories showing adequate performance on External Quality Assurance
Percentage of notified TB cases, all forms, contributed by non-NTP providers - private/non-governmental facilities
Percentage of registered new and relapse TB patients with documented HIV status
Percentage of TB patients with DST result for at least Rifampicin among the total number of notified (new and retreatment) cases in the same year
Number of notified TB cases (all forms) contributed by non-national TB program providers – community referrals
TCP-5.1 Number of people in contact with TB patients who began preventive therapy
Percentage of confirmed RR/MDR-TB cases tested for resistance to second-line drugs
Impact indicator for PAK-T-NTP
TB mortality rate per 100,000 population
TB incidence rate per 100,000 population
TB prevalence rate per 100,000 population
RR-TB and/or MDR-TB prevalence among new TB patients: Proportion of new TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB
Outcome indicator for PAK-T-NTP
Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated
Notification of RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases – Percentage of notified cases of bacteriologically confirmed, drug resistant RR-TB and/or MDR-TB as a proportion of all estimated RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases
Case notification rate of all forms of TB per 100,000 population - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases

Notification of RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases - Percentage of notified cases of bacteriologically confirmed, drug resistant RR-TB and/or MDR-TB⃰ as a proportion of the estimated number of RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases among notified TB cases

TB treatment coverage: Percentage of new and relapse cases that were notified and treated among the estimated number of incident TB cases in the same year (all form of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed)
Case notification rate per 100,000 population- bacteriologically-confirmed TB, new and relapse
Treatment success rate - bacteriologically confirmed TB cases
Treatment success rate of all forms of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
TB O-Other 1: Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated (shorter regimen)
